QuestDef.Description:
My lord, a young lady has approached the camp and requests to speak to you.
What should I tell her?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I'm too busy to be dealing with this.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You find "kitty" in a large cage in the back. It takes to you immediately.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A young lady enters your camp.
"Your majesty, ever since my parents were murdered by the Syndicate I've been on my own. I would never have made it if it weren't for 'Kitty'."
She recounts a story of finding an abandoned Stalker kitten and taking care of it. Soon, it became a fiercely protective companion for her.
"But now, ruffians have taken her. They'd never seen a 'tame' Stalker before and look to sell her. Can you help me?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You've been on your own long enough. Stay here, I'll rescue "Kitty".
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: She weeps, "Thank you so much, your majesty!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am not a pet saving service. Find a new pet.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
She cries, but what will happen to me without a protector?
"Maybe you'll find another dog or whatever you said it was," you respond.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You reached what appears to be a ruined house. You see "Kitty" in a cage in the back, ruffians in the front.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Wait. No one said they'd have knives. Let's go back and rethink this.

QuestDef.Description:
A man, barely sober enough to walk stumbles toward you.
"I am Bacco! Warrior of... warrior of..."
He seems to drift off for a few seconds. You are about to walk past him when he continues.
"I challenge you. No one defeats Bacco!"
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Accept his challenge and battle in single combat
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Have your men dispose of him (abandon the quest)
QuestDef.SuccessText: Bacco thanks you and joins your ranks.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Fight Bacco

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Have you men cut him down (abandon the quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Bacco lays confused on the ground looking skyward.
"What happened?" he asks.
"You are a fool, it almost got you killed." You answer.
You begin to leave but he scrambles up after you. At a look he stops, holding his arms in the air.
"Wait," he says. "Let me join you."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Very well, I will make you into a soldier
I have no use for fools.

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, a young lady has approached the camp and requests to speak to you.
What should I tell her?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Am I the only person who solves problems in this land?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A young lady enters camp. She seems...vaguely familiar.
"Your majesty, ever since my parents were murdered by the Syndicate, I've been on my own. I would never have made it if it weren't for 'Bill'."
She recounts her adventurers deep in the wilds when one day she came across "Bill".
"He was sleeping but I woke him up," she explains. Now, a dark wizard has come and taken him from her. He somehow put him back to sleep.
"I barely escaped, but came straight to you. Can you help me?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Stay here. We'll deal with this wizard..
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: She weeps, "Thank you so much, your majesty!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am very busy these days, young lady. I'm sorry.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
She cries, "But what will happen to me without a protector?"
"Pick up a weapon and protect yourself," you say "or get very good at running."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You have reached the ruins of an ancient temple. It is very quiet but you sense dark sorcery around you.
"I know he's here," you say. "The Dark Sorcerer seeks to bring about The Empire of Sorcery. I won't let that happen."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Oh wait. This is THE dark sorcerer. Let's get out of here!

QuestDef.Description:
Into the throne room come three very sad looking adventurers. They explain, at considerable length, that they met at a local pub and decided to go on a quest together. Unfortunately, this quest brought them to the ancient dungeon of Orilinor, Curgen's jailer.
This dungeon was thought to be lost and, frankly, it would have been better had it stayed lost. Upon opening it, a couple centuries worth of monster breeding was unleashed into the country side.
"Also, a demon known as Anithan is still there," they explain.
What do you want to do?
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Sigh. Can't you people get real jobs? You'll be helping clean up this mess.
QuestDef.SuccessText: Anithan is defeated and the book is yours. Using the books of your private study to translate the runes in the book, you are able to summon a demon to do your bidding. Unfortunately, the book disintegrates upon use.

Objective.Text: Find the cave that leads to the dungeon, defeat Anithan.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You manage to cause a cave in, sealing off the entrance to the vast labyrinth underneath but not before Anithan and his servants confront you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Ah. Yes...well..quite. We will just be leaving you to your cave.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to your capital with the untranslated book of demons.

Objective.Text: Return to the capital with the untranslated book of demon summoning.

QuestDef.Description:
Travelers tell legends of a spirit of violence and rage that lives in the wilds. They say he carries a sword as black as a raven's eye, and as hollow as a politician's prayer. There will be no protection for the travelers, armies and cities that he crosses. Flee or join the slaughtered legions that lay in his wake.
But, the hero that ends him can claim his sword, a legendary weapon forged on another world.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will be cautious of this creature's passing

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, there is a tiny man calling himself Mimbly who demands to speak with you.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Oh by all means, let anyone waltz in here. I think not.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You may yet make a good sovereign. Enjoy riding your reward.

GameModifier.StrVal2: This tamed Skath was a gift from Mimbly.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"They call me the gift giver. Or they would if they knew me. Here's how this works: I ask you a riddle. If you get it right, I send you on a quest to retrieve a valuable thing."
He looks around the camp you've set up. "That...that's not cheese I'm smelling...is it?
Here is my riddle, 'At night they come without being fetched. By day, they are lost without being stolen. What are they?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Crickets" he laughs? "What kind of education system do you have here? Don't answer that. For that answer, I give you a book to read.

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you a gift and tell you where you can find something that will help you travel in...well style."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "Socks. Research the 'technology' for socks. It'll help. Trust me."

GameModifier.StrVal2: Mimbly's Dancing boots may come in handy after all.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Time? Is that some sort of generic answer you give to riddles? Well, for your time, I will still give you a reward fitting your...majesty."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find what appears to be a friendly Skath (if a Skath can ever be called friendly). However, there are several other skaths around it that are...less friendly.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: This just isn't worth the danger.

QuestDef.Description: Sire, a village elder wishes to speak to you. Should we allow him to approach?
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: By all means, show him in.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I'm very busy, send him away.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A village elder approaches you.
"My Lord, you seem to be succeeding where we have failed," the village elder says. "We have tried to form a village near here, to provide care, safety and meal for the few that follow me. But we are little more than fatted calves for the darklings who come out at night to slaughter us. They consume more of our wheat than we do and eat more of our lambs. I have failed."
We look for a leader who can bring civilization back to our world. We would join you if you'll have us..

QuestChoiceDef.Description: We have no need for failures here. Take his supplies and remove him from my sight.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The elder growls, "You may be a rising power now, but rejecting potential allies makes you a fool!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Of course. We are glad to have you.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The elder smiles, "We are grateful for your wisdom. We will serve you until Destiny takes us."

QuestDef.Description: A disease has spread through your capital. Your citizen's sweat turns black, they begin to cough up ruined, shriveled pieces of flesh and then they are driven mad. The madness is as unusual as the disease, they attempt to go as far into the earth as possible, seeking out mines or deep cellars. Some attempt to bury themselves alive. Hundreds have already died, many more are currently sick.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The cave is a laboratory full of the Lich's elixirs and potions. The secrets of whatever he produced has died with him, and his plague is permanently ended.
Amoung the remains you find an amulet that was ancient even by the lich's standards.

Objective.Text: You need 50 Gildar to build the commune

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: A disease has spread through your capital. Your citizen's sweat turns black, they begin to cough up ruined, shriveled pieces of flesh and then they are driven mad. The madness is as unusual as the disease, they attempt to go as far into the earth as possible, seeking out mines or deep cellars. Some attempt to bury themselves alive. Hundreds have already died, many more are currently sick.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Build a great pyre and throw in the infected and anyone who has had contact with them. (-20 population)
Build communes for the sick and force them to live apart from us (-50 Gildar)
Cure the Disease (-50% Growth until you cast the Cure Plague spell)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You now have the Cure Plague spell in your spellbook, but it costs 250 Mana to cast. Until you cast it you have -50% to your growth.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The commune is empty. Black water lies stagnant in basins and washbowls, beds are soaked in blood and rotting flesh. Searching the area you find the sign of shuffling tracks leading out of town, toward an abandoned mine.

Objective.Text: Follow the tracks to the Mine

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The tracks lead into the mine. Even those that had fallen during the trip look to have been dragged into the mine by the others. Looking down into the darkness it seems empty and quiet, though no animals will come close to the entrance.

QuestDef.Description:
A group of adventurers comes running into the throne room. Their leader approaches you and tells you he was searching for a scroll of world changing power. Unfortunately, the scroll was seized by Urxens led by the infamous Kinor the Death Drinker. If Kinor learns the secrets to this book, he could become a real menace to the countryside.
"I'm really sorry, my lord," he says.
What do you want to do?
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Sigh. I'll fix your mess but you've all been drafted.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You have defeated Kinor and kept a valuable relic out of the hands of evil. Eric has agreed to translate the scroll allowing you to make use of it.
He reads it and a high pitched voice speaks, "I am Kax, the Avatar of Conquest. I have heard your request and it has been granted. Conquered populations will submit to their defeat."
[No more unrest penalty in conquered cities]

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You have tracked Kinor back to his hide out. A group of Urxen are inside and spot you. One particularly nasty one is holding a scroll and sneers at the adventurer, "Looking for this?"

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to your capital with the untranslated scroll.

Objective.Text: Return to the capital with the untranslated scroll.

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, a very small, strange man has requested an audience. He says his name is "Mimbly".
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Small? Strange? Not exactly an endorsement. Send him away.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You may yet make a good sovereign. Enjoy your reward.

GameModifier.StrVal2: The Gauntlets of Power were a gift from Mimbly the...well, whatever he is.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"Ah, yes, there you are. I am a...man from a different time and place. Yes...yes. You are a skeptic. But I also come bearing gifts that you may enjoy."
He sniffs around the room for a moment and holds his nose, "Plumbing. Yes...yes..It's coming. Not in time for you of course."
"Here is my riddle, 'What always runs but never walks, often murmurs, never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, has a mouth but never eats?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "A duck?" he laughs? "What kind of education system do you have here? Don't answer that. For that answer, I give you a book to read.

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it. It highlights rivers in particular.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Time? Is that some sort of generic answer you give to riddles? Well, for your time, I will still give you a reward fitting your...majesty."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you a gift and tell you where you can find the Gauntlets of Power."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "And some final advice: Bathing. It's acceptable to bathe more than twice a year."

GameModifier.StrVal2: Mimbly's Dancing boots may come in handy after all.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: On a pedestal are the gauntlets of power. However, a varied group of ruffians are attempting to take them.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I think I will leave and take a bath after all.

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, there is a tiny man calling himself Mimbly who demands to speak with you.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Oh, I've heard of him. He's nothing but trouble. Send him away.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You may yet make a good sovereign. The scroll you found will teach you a new spell.
[You have learned the strategic spell "Summon Imp of the Titan"]

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"They call me the gift giver. Or they would if they knew me. Here's how this works: I ask you a riddle. If you get it right, I send you on a quest to retrieve a valuable thing."
He looks around the dinner cooking, "Wow. You're going to eat that?"
Here is my riddle, 'When young, I am sweet in the sun. When middle-aged, I make you gay. When old, I am valued more than ever. What am I?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Blood" he laughs? "Really? Blood is sweet in the sun? Wow. I don't really know where to go with that. Let me give you a book to read."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Love? Seriously? Love? Well, for your time, I will still give you a reward fitting your...majesty."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you the location of a lost scroll that gives you a powerful spell."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "Speaking of wine, there's alcohol in that. You might want to douse that meal with it, if you know what I mean...Oh, who am I kidding, you have no idea do you?"

GameModifier.StrVal2: Mimbly's Amulet increases defense without..the work.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The broken down shop is a deception. Inside it are a series of so-called magicians guarding a scroll.
"The scroll belongs to us," one says. "You may not have it, regardless of what that imp told you."

QuestDef.Description: Somewhere out there is the Spider Queen. For long years her kingdom has spread across the ruined world. Civilization is her enemy. The rise of it must be stopped and to this end, she has unleashed her children upon us all.

GameModifier.StrVal: Emerald web of the Spider Queen

QuestDef.Description:
It is an uneasy night. The moon fades and disappears, as if a cloud passes before it, but the sky is clear. The hunter's kills hang from a tree, a few deer bleeding out and waiting to be butchered in the morning. But as the night darkens, and even the campfire light retreats to the coals, the cries begin.
At first it's movement in the smoke, then glimpses of fallen soldiers, still burdened by their armor, weapons and the wounds that killed them. Then the deer's corpses begin to kick and howl. One comes free of the rope and falls, head hanging broken to one side with a gash in its neck wide enough for a man's fist to reach in. It splatters dark blood on anyone who comes close, before finally being put down by your men.
You hope that this curse only affects your camp. But it does not, worse things have risen in the world.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I will purge the world of these terrors
QuestDef.SuccessText:
Inside the tomb a warhammer rests on a stone altar. An inscription in the altar reads:
"Forged to battle the necromancers of Al-Ashteroth and their unholy creations. With it the Sawol armies have fallen and their knowledge destroyed. The breach has been closed, may it never again be opened."

Objective.Text: Explore a tomb unearthed by the Night of Haunted Dreams.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: A tomb has been recently unearthed. Undead have been drawn to the light, like moths to a flame, but they are too afraid to go closer. You must wonder what has the power to scare the dead.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Fight through the undead to the tomb

QuestDef.Description: My lord, a young squire has approached the camp and requests to speak to you.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Can't you see I'm eating? Send him away.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You find Sir Kodrin tied in the corner of the house. He is shaken but otherwise unharmed.
"My Lord, thank you for rescuing me. I am embarrassed that I needed saving. Word has spread of your mighty rule. I am honored to join you."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A young man, dark haired and pale of face approaches. He could not be older than 15.
"My liege, Sir Kodrin was ambushed by Wilding raiders not far from here. He was on his way here to offer you his services. Can you help me rescue him?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: We can use all the help we can get. Lead the way.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The boy smiles, "Thank you so much, your majesty. My name is Calin, I am the one of the squires of Sir Kodrin."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: If he were worthy of my time, he wouldn't have been captured in the first place. Be gone.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The young boy breaks down. He sobs, "I believed in you! He believed in you!"

Objective.Text: Rescue Sir Kodrin from the so-called bandits.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You reached what appears to be a ruined house. But as you suspected from the beginning, it is a Syndicate hideout. The criminal powers continue to do what they can to keep civilization from returning.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Defeat the Syndicate kidnappers to free Sir Kodrin.
The Syndicate should not be trifled with. I will return later.

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, there is a tiny man calling himself Mimbly who demands to speak with you.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: This sound like trouble. Send him away.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You may yet make a good sovereign. The scroll you have found is extremely powerful.
Just be careful when you use it. The cities of the world will fall silent, you may lose family, you may lose friends. Well... let's not kid ourselves, you can't lose what you don't have.
[This scroll is in your inventory and when used reduces all cities population by half]

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"I am Mimbly," he says. "I have come to this place and this time to aid you. Your triumph will be good for this world."
He looks about your camp and cringes, "You and your men should probably do..your business somewhere that is not in the camp."
Here is my riddle, 'Three lives have I. Gentle enough to soothe the skin. Light enough to caress the sky. Hard enough to crack rocks. What am I?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you the location of a lost scroll that gives you a powerful spell."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "Speaking of water, it can be used for bathing too. Just thought I'd put that thought in your mind."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This scroll was given to you by Mimbly. It's better than nothing. But not much better.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "A cat?" he laughs? "Why? Because it has multiple lives? That's why you guess that? Wow. I don't really know where to go with that. Let me give you a book to read."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Romance? Look, I just gave that option randomly. Let me give you something equally random."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The broken down shop is a deception. Inside it are a series of so-called magicians guarding a scroll.
"The scroll belongs to us," one says. "You may not have it, regardless of what that imp told you."
Another hisses, "This scroll is far too powerful for you."

QuestDef.Description:
My lord, there is a tiny man calling himself Mimbly who demands to speak with you.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You may yet make a good sovereign. The scroll you found will teach you a new spell.
[You have learned the tactical spell "Confusion"]

A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"They call me the gift giver. Or they would if they knew me. Here's how this works: I ask you a riddle. If you get it right, I send you on a quest to retrieve a valuable thing."
He looks around the camp you've set up. "That...that's not cheese I'm smelling...is it?
Here is my riddle, 'I am always hungry, I must always be fed, The finger I touch, will soon turn red. What am I?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Blood" he laughs? "What kind of education system do you have here? Don't answer that. For that answer, I give you a book to read.

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Stars? Is that some sort of generic answer you give to riddles? Well, for your time, I will still give you a reward fitting your...majesty."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you the location of a lost scroll that gives you a powerful spell."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "Socks. Research the 'technology' for socks. It'll help. Trust me."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The broken down shop is a deception. Inside it are a series of so-called magicians guarding a scroll.
"The scroll belongs to us," one says. "You may not have it, regardless of what that imp told you."

QuestDef.Description: You dream of a time before heroes, when titans ruled Elemental and those with ambition and courage were ruthlessly hunted and destroyed. You dream of Lady Umber sitting atop her onyx throne, keenly aware of all the threats to her empire. Her armies, her magic, her guile kept her lands safe. But when a more delicate hand was needed, when a rebel hero arose or someone showed too much magical aptitude, she summoned aide. From the shadows a silent form, nearly invisible but for amaranthine eyes and the wisps of faded magic, answered that call.
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Seek out information about this creature
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I've no time for dreams (abandon the quest)
QuestDef.SuccessText:
The Amethyst Collar gleams in your hand. It is a powerful item that can be used to bind any Twisted to your service. Lady Umber used it to capture Ascian, but it would work as well on an Ogre, Darkling or cursed men.
Ascian lies somewhere in the world, if you wish to bind her to your service you will need to hunt her down.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find a library that may contain information about the creature.
QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The ancient library is full of dusty volumes that will interest your scholars. But you are most interested in a tome labeled "The echoes of Al-Ashteroth and the existence of Demons." Most scholars believe that demons were created by the cataclysm, that they are elementals, pure forms of the world's power that was bound, corrupted and twisted by Curgen. That they were driven mad, that they have come to hate things of flesh and delight in the pain and suffering of those that have reduced their world to ruin.
The author suggests that evidence of demons stretches well back before the cataclysm. There are stories of creatures that Arnor Tandis battled outside of Gemend that are unlike anything the world has known. The Pits of Grazna are said to contain creatures which feed on madness and sorrow and whose hunger will one day grow to consume the world. And the dark vassal of Lady Umber is mentioned as well, a creature that resembles the beasts of the Jungles of Khaffar, an eternal predator who passes silently between trees, shadows and worlds.
The creatures name is Ascian and the tome says that it served Lady Umber as an assassin because she bound the creature to her with an Amethyst Collar. Since the fall of Umber the creature is said to be free in the world, hunting as it desires and dragging those it stalks into endless darkness.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: If I find this Amethyst Collar I can bind Ascian to me

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Three demons guard the ruin. You almost mistook them for rune etched idols, but they leer and growl as you draw close.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll return with more troops later

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: You find the shattered remains of the Amethyst Collar with the ruins. It is useless. Someone looked to have been attempting to create a new one in the old shrine. A ritual has been laid out but whoever attempted it was unable to power it, despite their obvious knowledge of the enchanting process.

QuestDef.Description: Timed to strike on the anniversary of Curgen's death, a series of previously hidden redoubts have opened and released hordes of Abominations onto the land. Beware.

For years after the cataclysm, chaos ruled across the world. No one profited from that chaos more than the criminal organization called "The Syndicate"
With these new kingdoms and empires forming, they see their time passing and have responded with a major uprising. Across the land, Syndicate forces have come out of the wood work to terrorize the populace.
You must restore order before they do too much damage.

The sky is raining fire; rocks fall from above and sear the ground they touch. The screams of the dead and the dying fill the air; flames dance across the world like things alive, like the Anathua of old, the Fire Elementals worshipped in the House of Sirdir.
Random infernos placed in the world, all units take some damage, some ignys and fire elementals are spawned.

Civilization is returning to the world. Cities are being constructed. The wilds are being cleared. With each step forward, horrors, long thought banished from this world, are disturbed. Some of these beings of nightmares have been sighted. Vigilance.

Reports have come in that new techniques for finding gold deposits have been invented. As a result, many new gold deposits have been uncovered.
But beware, shiny things have a way of attracting the attention of undesirables.
A great earthquake has rocked the lands. In the wake of the destruction previously hidden relics from before the cataclysm have been unearthed. They now dot the land, waiting to be collected.

My lord, there is a tiny man calling himself Mimbly who demands to speak with you.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: He'll just insult us. Trust me on this. Tell him, thanks but no thanks.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You may yet make a good sovereign. The scroll you found will teach you a new spell.
[You have learned the strategic spell "Summon Abomination"]

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who couldn't be taller than 3 foot enters the room.
"I am Mimbly," he says. "I have come to this place and this time to aid you. Your triumph will be good for this world."
He looks at the dinner table, "A metal thing with little spikes on them is called a fork. Way better than hands."
Here is my riddle, 'Until I am measured, I am not known. Yet how you miss me, when I have flown. What am I?'"

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage:
The little man smiles, "There might be hope for you yet. For your wisdom, I will give you the location of a lost scroll that gives you a powerful spell."
As he leaves, he turns and adds, "Speaking of time, I know you Channelers age slowly but seriously, spend some time learning about forks."

GameModifier.StrVal2: Mimbly's Amulet increases defense without..the work.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Weight" he laughs? "Wow. I don't really know where to go with that. Let me give you a book to read."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This book has plenty of easy to understand pictures in it.

QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The little man laughs, "Love? Seriously? Love? Well, for your time, I will still give you a reward fitting your...majesty."

GameModifier.StrVal2: This dead rat will remind you of all the good times you had with Mimbly.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The broken down shop is a deception. Inside it are a series of so-called magicians guarding a scroll.
"The scroll belongs to us," one says. "You may not have it, regardless of what that imp told you."

QuestDef.Description: Civilization is returning to the world. Cities are being constructed. The creatures that believed they had inherited a world after the cataclysm will not go quietly away...

You are sitting in camp discussing the events of the past day. Suddenly, there is a loud booming sound followed by a hollow voice.
"We have returned," rumbles the voice. "We have returned to take what is ours. There is nothing you can do to stop us."
Without consciously understanding how, you realize the Titans have returned. Somehow, from whatever dark place they originate from, they have found a way back. The only way to stop them is to find their portal and close it.

My lord, some kind of sage or wizard approaches.
What should I tell him?
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Wizards are trouble, send him away.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
With Talax incapacitated, Dratho awakens.
"A dragon needing rescuing by a mortal. The Destiny have a sense of irony," Dratho says.
Looking at you he says, "Clearly, you are a noble creature. I shall aid thee here, at the end of things."
Let us end this.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A man who seems ancient beyond years enters your inner circle. He seems...familiar. For over two centuries you have struggled to bring order to this world. The world is now largely covered with cities and order of one kind or another.
"Hello, old friend", he says. You may not remember me, but I remember you. It is time to bring this struggle to an end. I have come with tidings of great import. The ancient Titan, Talax has been sighted. He put his might into subduing a mighty dragon. Now is the time to strike."
He explains that with swift action, the dragon might be recovered to aid you and Talax could be brought low for a time.
"If we are lucky, we can prevent Talax's designs to create an Empire of Sorcery."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Let us find this dragon of yours.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Excellent," he says. Perhaps my small power may be of some use. I shall join you on this journey. I shall put on my armor for battle.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I have no need for dragons. The time of the Channelers is here.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: He looks sadly at you, "That is unfortunate. For there are other events in this world that you know nothing about. You will need his help."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
This temple had been cleverly hidden until very recently. Only due to a titanic battle between the dragon and the ancient Titan has it become visible to the casual observer.
"This is going to be dangerous," you think to yourself. "Titans are not to be trifled with. But a dragon ally could stem the tide."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: On second thought, dying in my sleep sounds like a better choice.

QuestDef.Description:
The air crackles with the scent of lightning, and arcane magic. An energy has now been set loose in the world, an energy that feeds the savage in man and Fallen alike, an energy that strips away the mask of civilization, and lets loose the beast within.
All players declare war on every other player they know, unless they are in an alliance
